intro: Leucosyke corymbulosa, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers with white petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Leucosyke corymbulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
